channel.title: Moparscape crashes on startup! HELP ME PLEASE!
channel.description:
Im in quite a lot of confusion.
Moparscape will crash almost immediately on startup.
I used to know how to fix this, I left moparscape for a while, came back now and dont remember how to fix it. I also cant find ANYTHING on Google!

item.title: Moparscape crashes on startup! HELP ME PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @pro_banana pro banana
item.description:
@pro_banana wrote:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=409149.0

use this and it will work.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape crashes on startup! HELP ME PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @Crusix Crusix
item.description:
@Crusix wrote:

Noahlol:

actually i have a normal computer, windows, not vista, and it wont let me either it will say “loading animations:97%” then it will finish and in the black box in bottom it will say "Loading error:ondemand

Yeah, but that isn’t our problem. Our problem is, that when we get in game, about 5 seconds after we walk, the client just closes. We can stand there for hours, and nothing will happen. But soon as we move, crashed
If someone can find us some help on this, I would greatly appreciate it.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 27, 2009, 07:25:14 am[/size][hr][CODE] #

item.title: Moparscape crashes on startup! HELP ME PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @Noahlol Noahlol
item.description:
@Noahlol wrote:

actually i have a normal computer, windows, not vista, and it wont let me either it will say “loading animations:97%” then it will finish and in the black box in bottom it will say "Loading error:ondemand

Read full topic
item.source: Moparscape crashes on startup! HELP ME PLEASE!

item.title: Moparscape crashes on startup! HELP ME PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @Crusix Crusix
item.description:
@Crusix wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdood, post:3, topic:306143”]Im using Windows Vista Home Premium, and I am using the downloaded Moparscape 3.2 W/ Aryan .JAR version. (i hope you know that a .jar is a Java Executable)

Im using Internet Explorer 8 and Moparscape doesnt start in the web browser either. Im sure its a Java Security problem but I cant remember where to change it. I feel so stupid.[/quote]

I’m actually having the same exact problem. But I can tell you this, it is not a virus that’s doing it. I have even restored my computer, and I have two firewalls and 3 different virus scanners, so no virus. It is something with our Vista, because it works on the other computers I have. I actually cannot find anything on Google about this problem either, it seems as if we are the very few computers who have this problem. However, if you do find a solution, please message me with it. Sorry I cannot help you anymore than that.

Regards,
Crusix

Read full topic
item.source: Moparscape crashes on startup! HELP ME PLEASE!

item.title: Moparscape crashes on startup! HELP ME PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @iceypwnsu iceypwnsu
item.description:
@iceypwnsu wrote:

sk8rdood:

maybe if i run my virus scan. i think i have some viruses because i came across a folder the other day named “System32”. that just sounds like a virus. im gonna delete it now

[quote=“Brenhein, post:6, topic:306143”]-.- that is window’s system directory.
Only delete it if you want to reinstall windows,[/quote]
heres a few things you might be interested to know.
1 - your computer is not going to let you delete the windows files, for in the BIOS settings when you get your computer, the hard drive is locked, preventing you from doing it, through anything, but a windows disk, or unlocking the hard drive.
2 - if it does, then your computer really sucks.
3 - what you need to do is throw your computer out the window because i dont have a problem…

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape crashes on startup! HELP ME PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdood sk8rdood
item.description:
@sk8rdood wrote:

Im using Windows Vista Home Premium, and I am using the downloaded Moparscape 3.2 W/ Aryan .JAR version. (i hope you know that a .jar is a Java Executable)

Im using Internet Explorer 8 and Moparscape doesnt start in the web browser either. Im sure its a Java Security problem but I cant remember where to change it. I feel so stupid.
